AcidFormOfConjugatedAcid.description: A molecule capable of donating a proton. Example: carboxylic acid is an organic acid that contains a carboxyl group (C(=O)OH)[1] attached to an R-group

elemental_charge.description: number of protons minus number of electrons

has_atoms.description: Relation between a molecule and the atoms it contains. Note that this is a shortcut relation: for granular representations go via atom occurrences

has_bonds.description: The set of all bonds connecting atoms in a molecule

has_submolecules.description: Relation between a molecule and the molecules it is made from.

owl_subclass_of.description: Holds between C and P if C owl:subClassOf P. Note that in this model, most classes are metaclasses (see 'owl class'), where these metaclasses may represent *groupings* or specific countable elements or species. We provide two different sub-properties of subclass of for two cases: (1) subtype_of, which connects grouping classes (e.g. alkane is_a hydrocarbon; alpha-amino-acid is_a amino-acid), (2) classified_by, which connects a specific element to a grouping class (e.g. methane is_a hydrocarbon; iron is_a metal; serine is_a amino-acid)

AcidFormOfConjugatedAcid.title: AcidFormOfConjugatedAcid

Allotrope.description: A molecule consisting of atoms of the same element

has_atoms.description: Relation between a molecule and the atoms it contains. Note that this is a shortcut relation: for granular representations go via atom occurrences

has_bonding_structure.description: The pattern in which the atoms are bonded; e.g. hexagonal lattice, sheets, etc

has_bonds.description: The set of all bonds connecting atoms in a molecule

AtomGroupingClass.description: A grouping class that classifies atoms. For example, metal atom

AtomGroupingClass.title: AtomGroupingClass

AtomOccurrence.description: An occurrence of an atom in the context of a particular molecule. For example, one of two occurrences of oxygen in nitrate

coordination_number.description: The number of atoms bonded to the atom of interest. [https://doi.org/10.1021%2Fed083p791]

formal_charge.description: The charge remaining on an atom when all ligands are removed homolytically. [https://doi.org/10.1021%2Fed083p791]

owl_subclass_of.description: Holds between C and P if C owl:subClassOf P. Note that in this model, most classes are metaclasses (see 'owl class'), where these metaclasses may represent *groupings* or specific countable elements or species. We provide two different sub-properties of subclass of for two cases: (1) subtype_of, which connects grouping classes (e.g. alkane is_a hydrocarbon; alpha-amino-acid is_a amino-acid), (2) classified_by, which connects a specific element to a grouping class (e.g. methane is_a hydrocarbon; iron is_a metal; serine is_a amino-acid)

oxidation_number.description: The charge remaining on an atom when all ligands are removed heterolytically in their closed form, with the electrons being transferred to the more electronegative partner; homonuclear bonds do not contribute to the oxidation number. [https://doi.org/10.1021%2Fed083p791]

valence.description: the number of electrons that an atom uses in bonding [https://doi.org/10.1021%2Fed083p791]

AtomOccurrence.title: AtomOccurrence

AtomicBond.description: A connection between two atoms. Note this is the reified form of 'atomically connected to'.

bond_length_in_angstroms.description: the average distance between nuclei of two bonded atoms in a molecule. It is a transferable property of a bond between atoms of fixed types, relatively independent of the rest of the molecule.

bond_order.description: the number of electron pairs (bonds) between a pair of atoms

GeneralizedMolecularStructure.description: A molecule grouping class that can be written using a chemical formula using variables (e.g. n), or arithmetic expressions uing variables (e.g. 2n+2), plus optionally constraints on those variables (e.g. n>3). An example is alkane; CnH2n+2, which groups specific molecules such as methane

owl_subclass_of.description: Holds between C and P if C owl:subClassOf P. Note that in this model, most classes are metaclasses (see 'owl class'), where these metaclasses may represent *groupings* or specific countable elements or species. We provide two different sub-properties of subclass of for two cases: (1) subtype_of, which connects grouping classes (e.g. alkane is_a hydrocarbon; alpha-amino-acid is_a amino-acid), (2) classified_by, which connects a specific element to a grouping class (e.g. methane is_a hydrocarbon; iron is_a metal; serine is_a amino-acid)

subtype_of.description: grouping classes can be arranged in hierarchies arbitrarily deep. Note that subtype_of should only connect two grouping classes

owl_subclass_of.description: Holds between C and P if C owl:subClassOf P. Note that in this model, most classes are metaclasses (see 'owl class'), where these metaclasses may represent *groupings* or specific countable elements or species. We provide two different sub-properties of subclass of for two cases: (1) subtype_of, which connects grouping classes (e.g. alkane is_a hydrocarbon; alpha-amino-acid is_a amino-acid), (2) classified_by, which connects a specific element to a grouping class (e.g. methane is_a hydrocarbon; iron is_a metal; serine is_a amino-acid)

MonomolecularPolymer.description: A macromolecule composed of repeating subunits. Examples: cellulose

has_atoms.description: Relation between a molecule and the atoms it contains. Note that this is a shortcut relation: for granular representations go via atom occurrences

has_bonds.description: The set of all bonds connecting atoms in a molecule

has_submolecules.description: Relation between a molecule and the molecules it is made from.
